input:

19:34 Event: Throw-in by Paris

21:08 Caption: That didn't go as planned! Angel Di Maria (Paris SG) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort low towards the middle of the goal was too weak to get past Vladislav Stoyanov, who easily kept it out.

40:30 Caption: Goal! Marco Verratti produces a great pass that finds Blaise Matuidi (Paris SG) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the left side of the goal. 1:1.
40:43 Event: Kick-off by Ludogorets

43:56 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris

45:15 Caption: There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Pavel Kralovec has ended it.
45:59 Caption: The opening 45 minutes weren't very eventful and the game could be described as an average one. Even first half from both sides, and they've both had chances. The home team tries to prevail using combination football, while the away teams uses mostly counter-attacks.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Ludogorets
00:01 Caption: The whistle blows and Pavel Kralovec starts the second half.

04:03 Caption: It looked like the long-range shot by Angel Di Maria (Paris SG) would end up in the net, but the effort went painfully wide of the left post. The goalkeeper was quite lucky this time.
04:10 Event: Clearance by Ludogorets

04:33 Event: Yellow card by Ludogorets
04:47 Caption: Natanael (Ludogorets) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
05:07 Event: Direct free-kick by Paris
05:17 Event: Ball out of play
05:34 Event: Throw-in by Ludogorets
05:44 Caption: Angel Di Maria (Paris SG) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels low towards the middle of the target, but Vladislav Stoyanov easily deals with the threat.
05:48 Event: Shots on target by Paris
06:22 Event: Ball out of play

09:52 Event: Direct free-kick by Paris
09:53 Event: Shots on target by Paris
09:54 Event: Goal by Paris
10:19 Caption: A free kick is awarded from a very dangerous distance. It's situated just a few metres from outside the box. Several players gather around the ball, but it seems like Angel Di Maria (Paris SG) is going to have a crack himself.
10:21 Caption: Superbly taken set piece! Angel Di Maria takes the free kick and sends a cross into the six-yard box. Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) flicks the ball lightly with his head towards the middle of the goal. Vladislav Stoyanov can't react quickly enough and the score changes to 1:2.
10:50 Event: Kick-off by Ludogorets
10:56 Caption: Jonathan Cafu (Ludogorets) earns the yellow card.
11:00 Event: Foul by Paris

11:49 Event: Foul by Paris
11:53 Caption: Pavel Kralovec blows his whistle after Thiago Motta (Paris SG) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Ludogorets!
12:03 Event: Yellow card by Paris
12:49 Caption: A yellow card is awarded to Thiago Motta (Paris SG).
13:12 Event: Shots on target by Ludogorets
13:12 Event: Penalty by Ludogorets

13:30 Caption: Cosmin Moti (Ludogorets) blows a huge chance to score! He sends the penalty to the bottom left corner, but it's not enough to beat Alphonse Areola who easily stops the effort.

40:39 Caption: Jody Lukoki (Ludogorets) crosses into the box from near the side line, but he doesn't connect as he wanted and it's cleared by the well-organized defence.
42:12 Event: Ball out of play
42:27 Event: Substitution by Paris

42:46 Event: Substitution by Ludogorets

42:55 Event: Throw-in by Paris
44:38 Caption: The attendance is 17155.
44:58 Caption: Vladislav Stoyanov hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Blaise Matuidi (Paris SG) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
45:02 Event: Shots on target by Paris
45:07 Event: Ball out of play
45:19 Caption: The referee signals a substitution. Jean-Kevin Augustin (Paris SG) is brought on as a substitute for Edinson Cavani.
45:33 Event: Substitution by Paris
45:36 Event: Throw-in by Paris
45:42 Event: Ball out of play
45:53 Event: Throw-in by Ludogorets
46:14 Event: Ball out of play
46:19 Event: Throw-in by Ludogorets
47:16 Caption: Jody Lukoki (Ludogorets) takes a long-range shot, but his attempt is not a big threat to the goalkeeper.
48:11 Caption: Pavel Kralovec is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
48:59 Caption: All in all that was an entertaining 90 minutes of football thanks to some decent attacking play. An impressive display from the visitors, they had the better of it. In terms of strategy, the hosts were waiting for the right moment to win the ball and launch a counter-attack. The visiting side adopted a possession style of football.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a pulsating UEFA Champions League encounter, Ludogorets welcomed Paris Saint-Germain to their turf, with the match culminating in a compelling 3-1 victory for the visitors. The game, which saw numerous thrilling moments and vigorous displays of athleticism and technique, was a testament to European football at its competitive best.

From the very first whistle, Paris Saint-Germain showed their intent. They kicked off the ball promptly at 00:00, with an eagerness to seize control of the game. However, the initial proceedings were marked by some defensive rigidity from both sides, with the ball going out of play multiple times within the first few minutes. Paris attempted an attack within the initial seconds, but their throw-in at 01:38 was matched by a stout Ludogorets defense.

As early as the 2nd minute, Paris committed a foul, leading to an indirect free-kick for Ludogorets, echoing physical contestation early in the game. Ludogorets used their free-kick opportunities to push forward but ended up giving back possession after some wayward plays. Paris wasn’t immune to fouls either, giving Ludogorets additional chances with indirect free-kicks at 02:36 and 02:52, but neither team could capitalize.

A promising moment for Paris came with an attempt off-target at the 5th minute, highlighting their early offensive dangers. Ludogorets, however, reinforced their defense with effective clearances and held their ground. A throw-in at 08:03 saw Ludogorets defend resolutely once more. Although Paris was persistent, Ludogorets managed to avert potential goals repeatedly. A pattern of near-miss attacks continued with a save by the Ludogorets goalkeeper after an offside from Angel Di Maria at 11:06.

Ludogorets earned some opportunities but fell short in execution, with Anicet driving a shot high over the bar at the 11:55 mark. At 14:55, Ludogorets had a brilliant breakthrough when Natanael stepped up to take a free-kick, bending it perfectly into the right post and giving Ludogorets a 1-0 lead. This goal injected energy into the game, with Ludogorets celebrating a perfectly executed set-piece.

Paris responded with vigor, pushing forward with renewed aggression. Although Ludogorets continued to show strong defensive fortitude with critical clearances, Paris kept applying pressure. A clear effort came in the 21st minute when Angel Di Maria's shot was blocked by the Ludogorets goalkeeper. More fouls ensued, disrupting the game’s flow, with indirect free-kicks for both sides.

A defining moment for Paris came late in the first half when Marco Verratti's fantastic pass found Blaise Matuidi, who skillfully converted the ball into the left side of the goal at 40:00, bringing the score to 1-1. This goal was a turning point, indicating Paris's refusal to let Ludogorets run away with the game.

The intensity ramped up as the first half headed to a close, with Svetoslav Dyakov receiving a yellow card for a foul around the 44th minute, demonstrating the high stakes both teams had invested in this encounter. The half concluded with a balanced 1-1 scoreline, each team having showcased moments of brilliance but also lapses in precision.

The second half resumed with Ludogorets kicking off and quickly trying to assert control. However, a series of fouls disrupted their rhythm, including a tackle at 4:21 that led to a yellow card for Natanael, signaling an increasingly rough and physically demanding game.

Paris, seized their opportunity in the 54th minute. Angel Di Maria’s free-kick perfectly found Edinson Cavani, who headed the ball into the net, giving Paris a 2-1 lead. The game’s intensity escalated further after this moment. Jonathan Cafu of Ludogorets received a yellow card shortly after, and further fouls led to more bookings, indicating the increasing desperation in Ludogorets’s camp and resilience from Paris.

Despite Ludogorets's determined efforts, they squandered a golden opportunity when Cosmin Moti, stepped up to take a penalty at the 63rd minute, only for his effort to be stopped by Paris's goalkeeper, Alphonse Areola. This miss was critical, underlining the fine margins that often define football matches.

Paris, capitalized on Ludogorets’s deflation. In the 74th minute, Cavani received a pass from Lucas, beautifully slotting the ball into the right post to extend Paris's lead to 3-1. This goal didn’t just add to the scoreline; it significantly dampened the spirits of Ludogorets.

Despite continued efforts by Ludogorets, their play was frequently interrupted by unforced errors and fouls. Paris maintained defensive solidity, ensuring that Ludogorets's further attempts posed minimal threats. Substitutions from both sides aimed to inject fresh energy but largely didn’t alter the match’s course.

As the game neared its end, Ludogorets continued to press but found no clear route to breach Paris’s defense. Anicet’s shot in the 86th minute marked one of their last significant attempts, but by then, Paris’s victory was almost assured.

The final whistle at the 94th minute concluded a highly engaging match, seeing Paris come out as 3-1 victors. This match provided a clear demonstration of Paris Saint-Germain's class and ability to capitalize on key moments, while Ludogorets showcased admirable resistance and footballing spirit despite the loss.

In essence, this UEFA Champions League match was replete with exhilarating football, robust defense, pivotal moments of skill, and strategic execution. The 3-1 win for Paris underscored their quality and left Ludogorets reflecting on missed opportunities and the challenges of facing one of Europe's elite teams. The blend of crisp counter-attacks by Paris and Ludogorets's combination play made for a spectacular clash that both sets of fans will remember for days to come.
